sentence.Network_en: Furniture is so bulky, it takes so much room.
sentence.Network_cn: 家具体积太大，占了太多空间。

sentence.Network_en: It was bulky, perhaps three feet long and almost as high.
sentence.Network_cn: 它体积很大，大约有3英尺长，高度也将近3英尺。

sentence.Network_en: She thought she'd never been so glad to see his bulky form.
sentence.Network_cn: 她想她从来没有因看到他那肥胖的身躯而如此高兴。

entry.def: Something that is bulky is large and heavy. Bulky things are often difficult to move or deal with.

example.tran: 割草机之类的庞大物件
一个秃顶的大块头男人

means.word_mean: 1. of large size for its weight

auth_sentence.content: Crisp cotton shirts are too stiff and bulky on me.
auth_sentence.res_content: Crisp cotton shirts are too stiff and bulky on me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Crisp cotton shirts are too stiff and bulky on me.

auth_sentence.content: Bulky from a prison diet strong on starch.

auth_sentence.content: Bulky fibre-rich foods are also a good choice.
auth_sentence.res_content: Bulky fibre-rich foods are also a good choice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bulky fibre-rich foods are also a good choice.

sentences.en: Bulky clothes tend to hinder movement.
sentences.cn: 肥大的衣服常常碍手碍脚。

sentences.en: The climber took some food from the bulky pack on his back.
sentences.cn: 登山者从背后大包裹里拿出一些食物。

sentences.en: Her padded coat made her look very bulky.
sentences.cn: 穿着棉袄使她显得臃肿。

means.word_mean: 大块头的，粗壮的，高大肥胖的

sentences.en: The males are bulkier than the females.
